name: Marshall
review:
I've never been a huge fan of dark lipcolors, so I wasn't too excited about receiving my Revlon Ultra HD Matte Lipcolor in the shade Infatuation. In the bottle it is a deep, deep brown-ish plum shade - one that I would never choose for myself, but was happy to try on, nevertheless.

The scent was like all of the other HD Matte Lipcolors - sweet, almost fruity, like candy. I find it pleasant enough, though it is pretty pungent, so I would keep that in mind if you're not a fan of that sort of scent.

I swatched it first on my hand, which revealed that it was much more purple than was expected. I had expected more of a brown undertone, but this shade is very much a true, deep plum.

It swatched well on the hand, but on the lips was a whole other story. It went on streaky and patchy, a splotchy mess. The more I tried to even it out, the worse it became. And these don't dry down fully, so when I attempted a second coat to try and even it out further, it seemed to just pick back up what I first put down, and just move it around my lips. I had to work very, very carefully to get it to a point where I thought it looked decent - much longer than I would ever want to spend putting on a lip color. Maybe if you had a lip liner in the same shade, and filled in your lips before applying this, it would look okay with one layer, but I don't have a lip liner in this shade, so I couldn't try.

Darker lip shades are hard to do right - they are often patchy or streaky (especially purple tones), and , at least with this shade, Revlon did not manage to pull it off.

*This post was sponsored by Revlon as part of a sampling activation for Crowdtap. I received complimentary products to facilitate my review.*

name: Sophia
review: This post was sponsored by Revlon as part of a sampling activation for Crowdtap. I received complimentary products to facilitate my review.  To begin this review, let me just say for any prospective buyers that this formula is not long-lasting.  This is due at least in part, I suspect, to the fact that this lipstick never actually dries down on the lips.  Even after a solid 15 minutes of dry time, the lipstick remains rather sticky and very wet.  After half an hour of breathing, sipping water from a straw, and occasionally speaking, the color is mostly gone.  It's good that this a pretty but understated nude shade.  Otherwise, I suspect that the fading would be a much bigger problem than it is.  Seduction is a your lips but better type of nude--that is, it's not really a true nude, but a wearable, everyday kind of pinky color.  I think Seduction best works as a nude for people with light-medium complexions.  Too pale, and this won't really look like a nude at all.  Too dark, and this won't show up too well.  That's another weak spot; if you have very pigmented lips, expect, at the very least. to have your natural lip color more than peeking through.  Overall, for the price, there are better options, even in a drugstore, even if I do think the color is pretty and flattering for certain skintones.

I got this on a whim since it was on sale but I was pleasantly surprised by the product. I got the shade HD Glow and I love the color it comes in. It's not too bold yet still vibrant. Using a lip balm does help but it also weakens the staying power.
The staying power of the product is not bad. Depending on whether you are eating and drinking throughout the day, the wear will differ. Also if you are eating something that has oil or grease, it will wear it off more easily. It's easy to reapply, but I personally prefer to remove all or most of it because it can get clumpy. I also notice it can be clumpy if I apply too much at the start too. It would get clumpy in my lip lines, so less is more. Other than that, I really enjoy this product. I only have one shade so I can't tell if they are all consistent with their products, but I would definitely look into trying out other shades.

Sadly, even though I've had a great experience with most of their other types of makeup, this was subpar at best.

Pros: Smells great, tastes great, has some great classic colors that I think would look good on all skin tones, doesn't feather out (no lip liner needed), decent applicator

Cons: Doesn't dry matte, and it comes off so easily that I didn't even want to try and blot it matte, because I feared I'd end up with no lipstick on after that. The color I got was close to my own lip shade, so it was less noticeable that didn't stay on my lips than had I got a bolder color, which is my usual preference.

Now, if you go into this product with typical lipstick expectations (will need touch ups, will transfer, etc) than it's not a bad product. But it definitely doesn't live up to it's fellow liquid to matte lipsticks in the typical aspects we come to associate with this type of product.

review: I have, over the time since these came out, ended up buying every color that appeals to me. It was one of the first lipsticks I started wearing casually (not just for special occasions), and I love it. Applies more easily than many liquid/ gel lipsticks because it's a fairly thick, non-sticky formula. Most colors go on opaque and any streakiness can be fixed with a little more attention with the doe-foot. If your lips are moisturized and exfoliated, this wears really nicely. Not matte until later in wear (at least 30 minutes in, varies by shade), but shine is subtle and you can tap the surface with your fingers or blot lightly to reduce it. Comfortable, doesn't dry out the lips much, and when it does fade, it does so in a pretty graceful way. Definitely not going to look flawless forever or last through eating a burger, but I feel confident when I wear it that I don't look like a doofus. It reapplies fairly well over previous layers. One mistake I made was wearing it on sunburned lips. It looked pretty bad by the end of the night, but I think anything would have. The price point also means I can buy colors that are out of my comfort zone, so it's really helped me explore lipstick wear.

The downside to that is it doesn't dry completely so it does tend to wear off somewhat quickly (such as after drinking) but it's really not an inconvenience. It is a bit drying, so I recommend keeping up on daily moisturizing. What I usually do is slather on some lip balm (Burts Bees or something similar) then let it sit for about half an hour, then blot off the excess so the liquid lipstick can set on your lips and isn't floating on a thick layer of chapstick.

review: When I first tried this, I was disappointed to see that it looked just like a gloss. A few days later I decided to see how it was long-wearing, and was so happy to see that it turns into an excellent matte lip color. If you're looking for a matte lip color right away, you'd want to go for a quick matte lipstick, but if you have a bit of time before you need to be anywhere, definitely put this on. It starts a bit glossy but it does turn into a very matte lip color with great color payoff. I wore mine for longer than a five-hour shift at work and it still lasted long into the time afterwards. It isn't drying and it feels really nice, and there is a sweeter smell when it's first applied but I really like it. I'm so glad it paid off.

name: Eliz
review: Love this color has a great smooth feel does not dry out lips

name: Oh well
review: The color is great but it's not matte

name: Nikki

review: Its definitely not matte but the colors are really pretty

review: I got 2 colors, the pink was way pinker than in the tube, so I wasn't a fan of it. The nude color looked great though.

name: Jim the Runner - ha
review: I thought this was really great! The perfect matte lipstick and it looks even better the longer you wear it. The purple color is beautiful and not too bright. It looks really good on darker skin.

name: Karly
review: Absolutely love the color and it's easy to apply.  I am not a lipstick person or usually a outgoing color, but I love this! It really lasts log as well!!

name: Teddy
review: Not drying at all and feels great. Does need a little retouching and smells a bit weird to me but I still love it.

name: SarahC
review: This said matte but it's definitely a gloss. I returned it

name: Carli
review: I have a tendency to shy away from matte lipsticks because they tend to feel very uncomfortable on my lips. That is NOT the case with this lipstick. It's very comfortable and downright moisturizing. Furthermore, I'm VERY picky about the scent of lip products and I quite enjoy the scent of this lipstick. The applicator is very effective and easy to use. The payoff is great and not patchy. It lasts slightly longer than your average lipstick and about as long as I've had wear from other liquid lipsticks. I've already gone back and purchased other colors.

name: ActorKateMc
review: I really wanted to like this product, as I have rather thin lips and can't wear lip gloss or glossy lipstick. First off, the color is awful - it reminded me of calamine lotion (the stuff our moms would put on our bug bites), and the texture reminded me of cake batter. Don't bother with this one. I'd give it zero stars if I could.

name: Lilly
review: This product is amazing! Matte is always something that I have loved but need to steer clear of because it is so drying. Not this product though! This product goes on like a shiny lipgloss and dries looking like a matte lipstick. However, when the product dries on the lips it does not look dry or cracked. This product also wears extremely well. I am able to apply it in the morning and have it last through most meals and drinks throughout the day. I look forward to purchasing this product in other colors!

name: Karen
review:
This product is so good! It is longlasting but if you were to put your lip to a cup some product would come off. Yet you would not need to retouch your lipstick.
I would definately buy the other colors

name: Sophie Haynes
review: Just put on lips ,clear up the edges and go.I just to me has a little weird of a smell.

review: *For a matte nude it looked nice. I lined my lips with brown then applied the lip color. It wasn't too dry and I only had to reapply a few times.*

name: Maija
review: Love any lip products especially the liquid lipsticks

name: JUJU
review: I was kinda disappointed because it was not matte like after 15 minutes.. It was still super glossy, and when you apply it on, the colour texture was not quite even. But on the positive side, they do have a good amount of different colours.

name: Luu
review: After using a brand like colourpop, it's hard not to compare. Thos formula stays wet and slides while you wear it. Its a pretty color, but it doesnt completely dry. If you're looking for an actual liquid to matte brand, try something else.

name: Noelley
review: Have really loved this matte lip wand. I want more natural or nude/brown colors!!

name: Lindz the coffee lover
review: Loved this color on me and will be going back for the others!

name: ElloooElizeth
review: I love this product! It's long-lasting and keeps its color throughout the day with minimal reapplication. If you have dry lips, I'd advice to moisturize them before applying this product. It isn't as dry as other matte products, which could be good and bad. Good because your lips won't be dry, bad because it still has a little wet look. Overall, I love it and I already own two of these bad boys.

name: Luv
review: The color on the bottle is Decieving and the product is drying however it gets the job done for the price point

name: Curlz
review: This product is awesome. I'm only giving it 4stars because of the tiny color selection.

name: Blonde beauty
review: I love the color and consistency of this product but it doesn't dry matte. I would say it it more like a demi-matte because it isn't shiny but it certainly isn't full matte. The packaging is nice and I like the applicator a lot. I hope they make these in more colors.

name: Selena
review: This is not matte at all. It's a very glossy finish that never truly dries down. It transfers like crazy. I'm not impressed with the color range. It's okay, but I will not be purchasing any more.

name: Aliss
review: I tried this and the Maybelline ones that came out recently and they're pretty similar. I got a nude, a red and a berry in the Revlon and a berry and fuschia in the Maybelline. There are products that are more matte, but on me these do dry sufficiently matte/satin finish. What I love about these is how lightweight they are and how they're not too drying! I have dry everything and love a matte lip and it's been great to see improvements in formulae for lip products! I was delighted to find these at the drugstore as they were readily available, I could see the colors, returnable, sales etc... They're so lightweight I feel like I have nothing on, but then catch myself in the mirror, and whoa, pigmented lip product on my lips that I don't feel! I'm so glad matte lips are becoming more comfortable to sport and this product is among those I reach for often. The packaging is pleasing to the eye and nice to hold but too bulky and they don't fit into my makeup organizers' lipstick/gloss compartments. There is also a noticable smell if you are extremely sensitive. I highly recommend giving these a try.

name: Beauty
review: So I love this! It last longer than you would expect. It goes on glossy at first but once it dries it turns matte. I think the applicator works great! It smells great and has an opaque finish and the colors are bright and beautiful. The only thing I don't like is that it dries my lips out. I usually put a lip balm before I put lipstick on because my lips are sensitive and I can't do that with this matte lip. It clumps up and looks all weird. I can't wear this stuff often because of that reason. I will be buying more shades though because the colors and packaging are so pretty!

name: Annie
review: I bought this in Passion and Love. Both were lovely (Passion is a pretty berry color and Love is a bright cherry red) but neither were really very matte. I've been using these blended in with some lip balm which makes these turn into a great lip stain. The applicator sucks but if you're going to blend it with some lip balm, you really only need the applicator for dotting this on the lips (blend with a lip brush or your finger).

name: Annie
review: I heard about this lipstick and wanted to try it out; also at Ulta they had a buy one get one half off of Revlon so I decided to try it then when I got the Colorstay foundation.  When I first opened and tried it on quickly in the car I was like oh great another throw away lipstick but then I tried on the next day properly with a little foundation and eye makeup and I love it. I have the shade "seduction" and it really is the perfect nude.  I would recommend to wear two coats, applying the first, wait for it to dry and apply a second coat.

name: Bri
review: I have only purchased the shade Addiction, and I love it. For the price, you can't beat it. I was leery at first because they are so inexpensive but I love that the color has lasted as it do for me. I Applied at 6am and had breakfast and juice and it was still on. I lightly reapplied after lunch at 1pm just to bring back the intensity, But for the price I can't complain. Definitely will purchase some other shades as well.

name: Deisy Meza
review: I just purchased this product in the color seduction. I dries down to a semi-matte I would say. It's very long lasting. I can smile without it cracking. It doesn't crumble. I cannot wait to try out the other colors. Definitely a great product if you have a long day ahead!! Very satisfied!! I only wish they had a wider color selection or maybe I haven't seen the other colors they have. This product is a must try!!!

name: JenTheRedheadMUA
review:
I mean, you get what you pay for. I'm a make up artist who's used to ABH, Stila and Lime Crime liquid lipsticks that dry down to a nice velvety matte finish. Revlon missed the mark on this. It's very sticky feeling, and does NOT dry matte. The colors are incredible and super pigmented, but they're glossy. Also, the applicator is super weird in my opinion... It doesn't pick up the product in the tube very well, and is awkward to smooth on to your lips evenly. It's not a bad product, it's just not what it claims to be.

Overview for "Obsession" (hot pink):
Color: Fabulous.
Pigmentation: A+
Scent: Somewhat pleasant
Taste: Gross, chemical-y. Don't get it in your mouth.
Finish: Creamy and glossy. Messy, tranfers to everything if you're not careful.
Longevity: Lasted me 1 solid hour before fading completely.
Applicator: Weird, not my favorite design.
Packaging: Classy and stylish, reminiscent of Marc Jacobs cosmetics packaging,
Other: Makes a pretty decent cream cheek tint.

All in all, if you're looking for a matte lip, this one is not your bff. If you want super bright, creamy, shiny lips, I would definitely recommend this.

name: Sabrina
review: I bought the color seduction and im so disappointed. Its supposed to be a light nude but the one i got is completely different. Its redish orange and it makes my teeth yellow. Ive looked on the package millions of times and sure enough everytime it says seduction. Im si sad because the real seduction looks like such a pretty color.

name: Emily
review: Love the color selection. Goes on opaque which I love. Definitely gonna buying more!

name: Lilly the Lipstick Enthusiast
review: I was super excited to see a reasonably-priced matte lipstick that has pretty good reviews for just coming out. So I got the shade 'Seduction' because it seemed like an everyday shade, which is definitely is. I think unfortunately you get what you pay for. It never dries down to a matte, it wears off pretty quickly, and I need to apply a lot of coats to get even application. I was pretty disappointed honestly, but I'll still keep it to have a basic shade I can throw on before a meeting at work.

smells good! great neutral shade.
a little bit of feathering but it's not a deal breaker.

review: I just bought this the other day. I absolutely love the colors and it goes on smoothly. Even the best of matte lipsticks dry out your lips, but this one lasted a while before it dried out. The color stayed on for about 6 hours though.

review: I got this product for my wedding and I tried it today to make sure it would stay. Even through eating and drinking, the color was still bright by the end of the evening, after several hours of wear. Maybe reapply after a few hours but I thought it still looked great! Excited to find one that will work so well for my wedding! I usually also don't like lipstick or lipgloss but this one was great. It didn't feel like I had anything on!

review:
This goes on my lips perfectly. It smells
really good and is super bright. It feels hydrating and smooth.

name: KC
review: I have this in Seduction, and I absolutely love it! It doesn't dry down completely to a matte finish, but it is very comfortable to wear.
